Details.Textbox24: Clark Public Utilities is a customer-owned public utility district that provides electric and water service in Clark County, Washington. Some of its facilities are dedicated to serving either electric or water utility needs while some of its facilities will be identified as serving an overall utility function.
Details.Textbox73: Reporting Protocol: General Reporting Protocol 1.1 and associated updates and clarifications

Report.Name: Emissions_Report_CO2eGas
Report.Textbox21: Entity Emissions | Total in metric tons of CO2e

Report.Name: Emissions_Report_CO2eGas
Report.Textbox21: Entity Emissions | Total in metric tons of gas

list1_facilityname.facilityname: Facility Emissions | Clark's Commercial Office Buildings
list1_facilityname.facilityname3: Equity share - 100% | Entity controls the facility emissions - Yes

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Commercial Office Buildings Acetylene Gas for Welding See Clark's Commercial Office Building documentation. Emissions are based on actual purchases of acetylene. This quantity represents emissions associated with the reported quantity of acetylene.

Source Emissions | Commercial Office Buildings Diesel Emergency Generators, Biogenic See Clark's Commercial Office Building documentation. Emissions are based on actual purchases (62.7 gal) for the blended biodiesel powered emergency generators. This quantity represents the emissions associated with the reported quantity of biodiesel (B100) in blended biodiesel.

Source Emissions | Commercial Office Buildings Diesel Emergency Generators, Non-biogenic See Clark's Commercial Office Building documentation. Emissions are based on actual fuel purchases (703.6 gal) for the blended biodiesel powered emergency generators. This quantity represents the emissions associated with the reported quantity of diesel (Distillate Fuel Oil No. 2) in blended biodiesel.

Source Emissions | Commercial Office Buildings Engine Analizer Emissions (CO2 Fugitive Emissions) See Clark's Commercial Office Building documentation. Emissions are based on actual purchases of calibration gasses (BAR Low (7.8 cu. ft.) and BAR High (23.4 cu. ft.)) and quantity of propane and CO2 in these gasses.

Source Emissions | Commercial Office Buildings Engine Analizer Emissions (Propane Stationary Combustion) See Clark's Commercial Office Building documentation. Emissions are based on actual purchases of calibration gasses (BAR Low (7.8 cu. ft.) and BAR High (23.4 cu. ft.)) and quantity of propane and CO2 in these gasses.

Source Emissions | Commercial Office Buildings HFC/PFC Fugitive Emissions See Clark's Commercial Office Building documentation. Clark has opted to use a simplified estimation for HFC-134A emissions based on an inventory of Clarkâ€™s refrigeration and HVAC equipment.

Source Emissions | Commercial Office Buildings Propane Emergency Generators See Clark's Commercial Office Building documentation. Emissions are based on actual fuel purchases (150.0 gal) for the propane powered emergency generator. This quantity represents the emissions associated with the reported quantity of propane.

Source Emissions | Commercial Office Buildings Propane Forklifts See Clark's Commercial Office Building documentation. Emissions are based on actual purchases (1,209.0 gal) for the propane powered forklifts. This quantity represents the emission associated with the reported quantity of propane. Simplified estimation CH4 and N2O emission factors are based on TCR Tips for Estimating a Mobile Fleetâ€™s CH4 and N2O Emissions.

Source Emissions | Commercial Office Buildings Purchased Electricity See Clark's Commercial Office Building documentation. Clark has developed customized emission factors for its purchased electricity based on the energy sources used. Total electric energy used at Clark's commercial office buildings is shown in the energy balance diagram.

Source Emissions | Commercial Office Buildings Shielding Gas for Welding See Clark's Commercial Office Building documentation. Emissions are based on actual purchases (1,128 cu. ft. Argon75%/CO2 25%) of shielding gas used in welding.

list1_facilityname.facilityname3: Equity share - 100% | Entity controls the facility emissions - Yes

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Mobile Fleet Diesel Heavy Duty Vehicle, All Model Years, Biogenic See Clark's Fleet Vehicle Emission documentation. Emissions based on actual fuel purchased (7,944.5 gal.) and recorded mileage (48,212 mi.) of diesel heavy duty vehicles of various model years. The emissions are based on emission factors from Tables 13.1 and 13.4 of the GRP. Note that this represents the emissions associated with biodiesel (B100) content of blended bio-diesel.

Source Emissions | Mobile Fleet Diesel Heavy Duty Vehicle, All Model Years, Non-biogenic See Clark's Fleet Vehicle Emission documentation. Emissions based on actual fuel purchased (72,646.4 gal.) and recorded mileage (440,858 mi.) of diesel heavy duty vehicles of various model years. The emissions are based on emission factors from Tables 13.1 and 13.4 of the GRP. Note that this represents the emissions associated with diesel (Distillate Fuel Oil No. 2) content of blended bio-diesel.

Detail.EndUseSector: Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses
Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses
Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Mobile Fleet Diesel Small Tools and Construction Equipment, Biogenic See Clark's Fleet Vehicle Emission documentation. Emissions based on actual fuel purchased (138.8 gal.) for biodiesel small tools and construction equipment. The emissions are based on emission factors from Tables 13.1 and 13.6 of the GRP. Note that this represents the emission associated with biodiesel (B100) content of blended bio-diesel.

Source Emissions | Mobile Fleet Diesel Small Tools and Construction Equipment, Non-biogenic See Clark's Fleet Vehicle Emission documentation. Emissions based on actual fuel purchased (1,194.4 gal.) for biodiesel small tools and construction equipment. The emissions are based on emission factors from Tables 13.1 and 13.6 of the GRP. Note that this represents the emission associated with diesel (Distillate Fuel Oil No. 2) content of blended bio-diesel.

Source Emissions | Mobile Fleet Gasoline Heavy Duty Vehicles, All Model Years See Clark's Fleet Vehicle Emission documentation. Emissions based on actual fuel purchased (31,909.6 gal.) and recorded mileage (279,987 mi.) of motor gasoline heavy duty vehicles of various model years. The pre-calculated emissions are based on model year specific emission factors from Tables 13.1 and 13.4 of the GRP.

Source Emissions | Mobile Fleet Gasoline Light Trucks, All Model Years See Clark's Fleet Vehicle Emission documentation. Emissions based on actual fuel purchased (28,030.7 gal.) and recorded mileage (470,703 mi.) of motor gasoline light trucks of various model years. The pre-calculated emissions are based on model year specific emission factors from Tables 13.1 and 13.4 of the GRP.

Source Emissions | Mobile Fleet Gasoline Passenger Cars, All Model Years See Clark's Fleet Vehicle Emission documentation. Emissions based on actual fuel purchased (810.7 gal.) and recorded mileage (36,508 mi.) of motor gasoline passenger cars of various model years. The pre-calculated emissions are based on model year specific emission factors from Tables 13.1 and 13.4 of the GRP.

Source Emissions | Mobile Fleet Gasoline Small Tools and Construction Equipment See Clark's Fleet Vehicle Emission documentation. Emissions based on actual fuel purchased (1933.0 gal.) of motor gasoline small tools and construction equipment. The emissions are based on emission factors from Tables 13.1 and 13.6 of the GRP.

Source Emissions | Mobile Fleet Propane Light Trucks, All Model Years See Clark's Fleet Vehicle Emission documentation. Emissions based on actual fuel purchased (1.2 gal.) and recorded mileage (0 mi.) of propane light trucks of various model years. The pre-calculated emissions are based on model year specific emission factors from Table 13.1. Emission factors are based on Table 13.1 of the GRP and the TCR Tips for Estimating a Mobile Fleetâ€™s CH4 and N2O Emissions.

Source Emissions | Mobile Fleet Vehicle HFC/PFC Fugitive Emissions See Clark's Fleet Vehicle Emission documentation. Clark has opted to use a simplified estimation for HFC-134A emissions based on an inventory of Clarkâ€™s refrigeration and HVAC equipment. Clark has assumed that all highway vehicles (155 vehicles) are equipped with air conditioning.
Source Emissions | XDiscontinued biodiesel Heavy Duty Vehicle, All Model Years Emissions of CO2 reported as Mobile Biomass Combustion.

Detail.EndUseSector: Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses
Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses
Diesel Medium and Heavy-Duty Trucks and Busses

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | XDiscontinued biodiesel Small Tools and Construction Equipment Emissions of CO2 reported as Mobile Biomass Combustion.

list1_facilityname.facilityname: Facility Emissions | Clark's River Road Generating Plant
list1_facilityname.facilityname3: Equity share - 100% | Entity controls the facility emissions - Yes
list1_facilityname.facilityname2: 5201 N.W. Lower River Road, Vancouver, Washington, 98660, US

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | River Road Acetylene Gas for Welding See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Clark did not purchase any acetylene at River Road in 2010.

Source Emissions | River Road CO2 Fire Suppression and Generator Purging System See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on actual CO2 purchases (8,850 lbs) for the fire suppression system and generator purging system.

Source Emissions | River Road Diesel Fire Pump and Emergency Generator, Biogenic See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on actual fuel purchases (180.4 gal) for the blended biodiesel powered emergency fire pump and backup generators. This quantity represents the emissions associated with the reported quantity of biodiesel (B100) in blended biodiesel.

Source Emissions | River Road Diesel Fire Pump and Emergency Generator, Non-biogenic See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on actual fuel purchases (3,884.8 gal) for the blended biodiesel powered emergency fire pump and backup generators. This quantity represents the emissions associated with the reported quantity of diesel (Distillate Fuel Oil No. 2) in blended biodiesel.

Source Emissions | River Road Diesel Small Tools and Construction Equipment, Biogenic See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on actual fuel purchases (10.0 gal) for the blended biodiesel powered small tools and construction equipment including the Gradall lift truck. This quantity represents the emissions associated with the reported quantity of biodiesel (B100) in blended biodiesel.

Source Emissions | River Road Diesel Small Tools and Construction Equipment, Non-biogenic See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on actual fuel purchases (94.6 gal) for the blended biodiesel powered small tools and construction equipment including the Gradall lift truck. This quantity represents the emissions associated with the reported quantity of diesel (Distillate Fuel Oil No. 2) in blended biodiesel.
Source Emissions | River Road Gas Analyzer See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on estimate of using entire cylinder of test methane for gas quality tester calibration.

Source Emissions | River Road HFC/PFC Fugitive Emissions See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Clark has opted to use a simplified estimation for HFC-134A emissions based on an inventory of Clarkâ€™s refrigeration and HVAC equipment.

Source Emissions | River Road Kerosene Portable Heaters See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions based on actual fuel purchases (60 gal.) for kerosene portable heaters. The emissions are based on emission factors from Tables 12.1 and 12.9 of the GRP.

Source Emissions | River Road Natural Gas Combustion Turbine See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on NW Pipeline reported gas quantities purchased by the plant. Internal plant metering is used to allocate amounts of natural gas purchased to the combustion turbine, gas heater, or startup boiler.

Source Emissions | River Road Natural Gas Gas Heater See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on NW Pipeline reported gas quantities purchased by the plant. Internal plant metering is used to allocate amounts of natural gas purchased to the combustion turbine, gas heater, or startup boiler.

Source Emissions | River Road Natural Gas Startup Boiler See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on NW Pipeline reported gas quantities purchased by the plant. Internal plant metering is used to allocate amounts of natural gas purchased to the combustion turbine, gas heater, or startup boiler.

Source Emissions | River Road Propane Small Tools and Construction Equipment See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on actual purchases of propane for the propane powered small tools and construction equipment including the forklift truck and gas grill. Emission factors are based on Table 13.1 of the GRP and the TCR Tips for Estimating a Mobile Fleet's CH4 and N2O emissions.

Source Emissions | River Road Use of Purchased Electricity See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Clark has developed customized emission factors for its purchased electricity based on the energy sources used. Total electric energy used at River Road is shown in the energy balance diagram.

Source Emissions | XDiscontinued River Road Diesel Small Tools and Construction Equipment, Non-biogenic See Clark's River Road Emission documentation. Emissions are based on actual fuel purchases (10.0 gal) for the blended biodiesel powered small tools and construction equipment including the Gradall lift truck. This quantity represents the emissions associated with the reported quantity of biodiesel (B100) in blended biodiesel.

list1_facilityname.facilityname: Facility Emissions | Clark's Transmission and Distribution System
list1_facilityname.facilityname3: Equity share - 100% | Entity controls the facility emissions - Yes

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Transmission and Distribution HFC/PFC Fugitive Emissions See Clark's T&D System documentation. Clark has opted to use a simplified estimation for HFC-410A emissions based on an inventory of Clarkâ€™s refrigeration and HVAC equipment.

Source Emissions | Transmission and Distribution Purchased Electricity for System Losses See Clark's T&D System documentation. Clark has developed customized emission factors for its purchased electricity based on the energy sources used. Total electric energy used at Clark's T&D System is shown in the energy balance diagram.
Source Emissions | Transmission and Distribution SF6 Fugitive Emissions See Clark's T&D System documentation. Emissions are based on actual inventories of SF6 gas.

list1_facilityname.facilityname3: Equity share - 100% | Entity controls the facility emissions - Yes

list1_SourceName.SourceName: Source Emissions | Water System Purchased Electricity See Clark's Water System documentation. Clark has developed customized emission factors for its purchased electricity based on the energy sources used. Total electric energy used at Clark's water system is shown in the energy balance diagram.
